name: Vocoder
description:
This algorithm implements a vocoder. The spectral characteristics of the modulator input are applied to the carrier input. In classic usage, the modulator might be a human voice, and the carrier might be a synth sound, or simply noise.

This version emulates an analogue vocoder inasmuch as it uses a number of bandpass filters to do the analysis and synthesis. There is also the Spectral Vocoder (above) which uses an FFT method.
gui_description: The display shows the current level of the modulator bands.

parameters.name: Bands
parameters.description: The number of bands into which the signals are split.

parameters.name: Bandwidth
parameters.description: Applies a scaling to the width of the bandpass filters.

parameters.name: Attack
parameters.description:
Sets the attack time of the band envelope trackers.
Exponential scaling from 0.5ms to 1000ms.

parameters.name: Decay
parameters.description:
Sets the decay time of the band envelope trackers.
Exponential scaling from 0.5ms to 1000ms.

parameters.name: High pass
parameters.description: Sets the frequency of a high-pass filter applied to both the modulator and carrier.

parameters.name: Noise
parameters.description: Sets the level of noise added to the carrier input, which can improve speech intelligibility. The noise is high-pass filtered at the frequency of the highest vocoder band.

parameters.name: Carrier width
parameters.description: The number of carrier busses to process. For example, for a stereo signal, set this to 2.

parameters.name: Output mode
parameters.description: The standard Add/Replace mode selector as described above.

input_ports.name: Modulator input
input_ports.description: Input for the modulator signal (e.g., human voice)

input_ports.name: Carrier input
input_ports.description: Input for the carrier signal (e.g., synth sound or noise)

input_ports.name: Modulator input
input_ports.description: The bus to use for the modulator signal.

input_ports.name: Carrier input
input_ports.description: The first carrier bus to process.
